isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14618 AND RTLO-16618 SERIES - INSTALL - LEFT COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Move the left countershaft assembly to the rear and insert the countershaft support tool or blocking to center the shaft in the rear case bore ( Figure 241).

figure.caption: Figure 241. Insert Countershaft Support Tool or Blocking to Center the Shaft

step1.para: Use a flanged end bearing driver to start the bearing in the case bore ( Figure 242).

figure.caption: Figure 242. Use Bearing Driver to Start Bearing in Case Bore

note.para: The inner race of the roller-type front bearing is pressed on the front of the countershaft.

step1.para: Center the front of the left countershaft in the bearing and move the assembly forward ( Figure 243).

figure.caption: Figure 243. Center Front of Left Countershaft in Bearing

step1.para: Use a flanged end bearing driver to completely seat the front bearing or bearing outer race in the case bore ( Figure 244).

figure.caption: Figure 244. Seat Front Bearing or Bearing Outer Race in Case Bore

step1.para: Position the retainer plate on the front of the left countershaft, roll pin in the hole at the end of the shaft, and secure with a bolt ( Figure 245). Tighten to 90 to 120 ft-lbs. (122 to 163 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 245. Position Retainer Plate on Front of Left Countershaft

step1.para: Remove countershaft support tool or blocking from rear case bore and install the left countershaft rear bearing with the larger I.D. lead chamfer to the front of the shaft and install the snap ring in the groove at the rear of the left countershaft ( Figure 246).

figure.caption: Figure 246. Install Left Countershaft Rear Bearing
